N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8000.4 - State access highway

State Regulations

State access highways are those segments of State highways
providing access between a qualifying highway and terminals, facilities for
food, fuel, repair, and rest (and in addition, for points of loading and
unloading for household goods carriers) that are designated by the Commissioner
of Transportation in this Chapter as access highways. Unless otherwise
prescribed in this Chapter, all State highways intersecting or meeting a
qualifying highway are hereby designated as access highways for a distance of
1500 feet from point of entrance to or exit from the qualifying highway
only. Notes
